articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun observes Women's Day 
    Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun dedicates an editorial to the 94th March 8 International Women's Day.
 The editorial says:
 The DPRK women and people pay their deepest respects to President   Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il who glorified the dignity and personalities of women and brought them up as a powerful force of the Songun revolution.
 The struggle for social and political independence of the women has started in our country under the leadership of Kim Il Sung.
 Kang Pan Sok founded the Anti-Japanese Women's Association, the first revolutionary women's organization in Korea, under the leadership of the President and led the women to the sacred revolutionary struggle against all sorts of the Japanese imperialists' exploitation and oppression and personal subordination and for the liberation of the country. During the days of the anti-Japanese struggle Kim Jong Suk, an indomitable revolutionary fighter, awakened women to rise up in the sacred war against the Japanese imperialists true to the intention of the President and made an immortal contribution to the history of the Korean women's movement.
 The President personally worked out the "10-Point Program of the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland" during the rigorous anti-Japanese revolution to clarify the issue of respecting the personalities of women. He enacted and proclaimed the Law n Sex Equality after the liberation of the country. Since then the Korean women have grown up as a powerful social force rolling one of the two wheels of revolution and greatly contributed to the development of the era.
 The women's movement covered the proud road of victory under the wise leadership of the President and has come to develop on a new high stage in the era of Songun led by Kim Jong Il.
 Among the women upholding his Songun leadership with loyalty are many deputies to the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, party officials, directors of factories and enterprises, managerial chairpersons of farms, renowned scientists and heroines, illustrious sportswomen and artistes. It is really significant that the role of women has remarkably increased in consolidating the single-hearted unity of the ranks of our revolution with the headquarters of revolution as their centre and stepping up the cause of socialism under the banner of great Songun.
